frequencies.verification_notes: Confirmed from Viasat official announcement. Integrated RF architecture with precision reflector surface accuracy. Multi-band capability from L-band to above Ka-band. Supports multiple bands with extremely high-power amplifiers.

orbit.verification_notes: Confirmed ground-based infrastructure. Not applicable to orbit. Supports spacecraft from LEO to lunar and beyond.

items.notes: Large-aperture antennas: 19.7 to 24.0 meters diameter; full-motion multi-band with high-dynamic pedestal for precise tracking; supports multi-orbit missions from LEO to lunar, cislunar, deep space, and DoD missions; only a handful strategically positioned globally can provide constant connectivity for lunar direct-to-earth and cislunar relay; precision reflector surface accuracy; extremely high-power amplifiers; advanced high-rate modems with SDR frameworks; announced January 20, 2022

items.model: HALO Lunar Communication System (part of Lunar Gateway)

trl.verification_notes: Confirmed TRL 7. HALO pressurized module completed environmental tests, shipped to Gilbert, Arizona for outfitting by Northrop Grumman. ESA Lunar Link critical design review completed 2023, manufacturing/testing underway at Thales Alenia Space France. Launch no earlier than 2027.

mass_kg.verification_notes: Confirmed from ESA official page. Lunar Link (HLCS) mass: 270 kg. Does not include HALO module itself (HALO module: 3m diameter, ~7m length, derived from Cygnus). Lunar Link dimensions: 2.5m x 2.5m.

power_kw.verification_notes: Confirmed from ESA official page. Lunar Link power consumption: up to 600W (0.6 kW).

cost_usd.verification_notes: Not publicly disclosed. Part of Gateway program. ESA contribution to international partnership. Specific Lunar Link development cost not published separately from Gateway program budget.

procurement_lead_time.verification_notes: Confirmed from ESA official page. HALO with Lunar Link and NASA PPE will be first Gateway elements. Launch no earlier than 2027. HALO currently in final outfitting. Lunar Link manufacturing/testing underway, will be integrated with HALO before launch.

data_rates.value: Few Kbps up to 25 Mbps (distance-dependent); Ka-band forward link: 5-40 Msps coded symbol rates
data_rates.verification_notes: Confirmed from ESA official page. Data rates vary from few Kbps to 25 Mbps depending on distance. Supports live video transmission and high-resolution streaming at up to 70,000 km distance. Ka-band supports LDPC error correction (1/2, 2/3, 4/5, 7/8 rates) and 5-40 Msps symbol rates.

frequencies.value: S-band (low gain antennas), Ka-band (high data rate)
frequencies.verification_notes: Confirmed from ESA and NASA sources. HLCS S-band system uses fixed low-gain antennas with network waveforms and ranging. Ka-band Lunar Link provides high data rate connections. Two 125cm dish antennas plus two low-gain antennas. Specific GHz ranges not disclosed.

orbit.verification_notes: Confirmed from ESA. Part of Lunar Gateway space station in NRHO. Furthest point: 70,000 km from lunar surface. Provides communication between Gateway, lunar surface assets (rovers), lunar orbit assets (satellites), and Earth.

items.notes: ESA-provided Lunar Link (HLCS) for Gateway; 270 kg, 2.5m x 2.5m, up to 600W; two 125cm dish antennas + two low-gain antennas; enables simultaneous independent communication with multiple targets; S-band and Ka-band; live video transmission capability; HALO module: 3m diameter, ~7m length, 3 docking ports, sustains 4 astronauts up to 30 days; Thales Alenia Space Italy built pressurized module, France building Lunar Link; Northrop Grumman outfitting; derived from Cygnus; launch no earlier than 2027 with PPE
